results.title: Two/out [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Catherine Kerr, Kriv Stenders and Pod Films
results.brief_description:
Jack and Tom are cellmates with a tenuous friendship. Their fragile bond begins to unravel when Jack develops dementia, and Tom, unable to understand Jack’s condition forces them into a physical confrontation which challenges the nature of their relationship.
Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two years or more
results.creator_credit: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB, Gilles Therien and Georges Dufaux
results.brief_description: An inside look at a modern federal penal institution of the kind built during the past decade, showing improvements that have been made not only in the physical facilities for housing inmates but also in the treatment and training programs. Emphasis is now placed on rehabilitation of the individual rather than on punishment for his crime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB, Gilles Therien and Georges Dufaux

results.title: Two women = Do zan [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Arman Film, Arta Film and Tahmineh Milani
results.brief_description: Two women, Fereshteh (Niki Karimi) and Roya (Marila Zare’i) become friends while studying at Tehran University. There’s a cloud of doubt over whether the university will stay open however, there’s rioting, and Fereshteh fears her future plans to become educated and enlightened will not eventuate. One day she is approached by a girl at university who wants to introduce her to Ahmad, a potential husband, she’s also being harassed by a man who follows her around campus and insists he is in love with her. One day the man sees her with her cousin and, believing him to be her lover, throws acid on him. Fereshteh is unfairly blamed for the incident and her father demands she leave university and return home. An unfortunate accident removes her harasser when he is sent to jail, but Fereshteh is held to blame also and is bailed out by Ahmad, her life and family honour indebted to him due to his financial assistance. Milani’s fifth film is an accomplished piece about a woman stifled in her attempt at liberation by a trinity involving her father, her husband, and a stranger. In Farsi with English subtitles.

results.title: Two wheeler
results.creator_credit: Len Aitken, Bill Snyder and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: This film provides a penetrating view inside the world of bicycle racing. The colour and excitement of the sport are experienced as the camera follows a race from the exhilarating start to the pressure and frustration of the finish. Dramatic camera angles and comments by the racers involve the audience in strategy and techniques. There is appealing action for the non-bicycler as well as the seasoned racer.

results.title: Two union leaders talk about workers and health
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Boyce Richardson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Challenge for change/Societe nouvelle
Jim Fill, director of legislation and community affairs of the United Auto Workers in Canada, and Dave Patterson, president of local 6500 of the United Steelworkers of America in Sudbury, Ontario, describe briefly how workers are trying to get more control over conditions in their places of work. Patterson says that the worker used to have only two rights: the right to disease and the right to death. However, progress is slowly being made. In two provinces the worker now has the legal right to refuse a job which the worker considers hazardous.

results.title: Two trumpets for St Andrew
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Intertel and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: Through the rivalry of two trumpeters representing brass bands of St Andrew’s Club and the Union Club, in Luga, Southern Malta, we are shown a picture of Maltese life, changing from its age-old religious conformities to meet with the demands of the 20th century, which is rapidly encroaching on its social and cultural customs.

results.title: Two towns: Gubbio in Italy, Chillicothe in Ohio
results.creator_credit: John H. Secondari, Learning Corporation of America and Helen Jean Secondari
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Explains that the towns of Gubbio in Italy and Chillicothe in southeastern Ohio are both agricultural centres of about 30,000 people. Describes the different value systems based on historical, cultural and geographical factors. Shows scenes of daily routines.
